World.title: Trump authorises 'full force' as Portland becomes latest city to see troops deployed
World.description: The president says the latest move to send troops to a major US city is "necessary" to protect immigration detention facilities.

World.title: Japan's Konbini convenience stores coming to the U.S.
World.description: In Japan, Konbini convenience stores have become part of the country's infrastructure, offering fresh meals delivered several times a day, tickets to concerts and museums, and even services like bill payments. Now the model is coming to the U.S., where critics question whether it will resonate with American customers.

World.title: Ukrainians react to President Trump's new stance on the war with Russia
World.description: Olga Rudenko, chief editor of the Kyiv Independent, talks about how Ukrainians view President Trump's shift from praising Vladimir Putin to backing Ukraine's full territorial recovery, and what it could mean for the war.

Politics.title: Comey's indictment marks a dramatic escalation in Trump's political retribution efforts
Politics.description: Former FBI Director James Comey has been indicted after a push by President Trump. The move marks a dramatic escalation in Trump's effort to go after his political opponents.

Politics.title: PM takes aim at 'toxic' Reform as Labour conference gets going
Politics.description: The Labour conference is set to be dominated by questions over how to respond to Nigel Farage's party.

Politics.title: Trump says he will send troops to Portland to deal with 'domestic terrorists'
Politics.description: President Trump is authorizing the deployment of troops to "protect" Portland and ICE facilities there from "domestic terrorists" as he expands his controversial deployments to more U.S. cities.

Politics.title: A look at former FBI Director James Comey's indictment
Politics.description: We examine the indictment of former FBI Director James Comey after President Trump called for several of his political enemies -- including Comey -- to be prosecuted.

Politics.title: Wisconsin Republican Sen. Ron Johnson explains his proposed 'Eliminate Shutdowns Act'
Politics.description: NPR's Scott Simon talks with Sen. Ron Johnson of Wisconsin about the looming government shutdown, and his proposed bill that aims to end shutdowns for good.

Politics.title: A Trump Republican critic urges constituents to oppose an effort to remove him
Politics.description: President Trump's most outspoken Republican critic on Capitol Hill is facing immense pressure to fold or pay the price. Now, Kentucky Congressman Thomas Massie is asking constituents to fight an effort to oust him.

Politics.title: Week in Politics: Comey's indictment; Trump at the U.N.; potential government shutdown
Politics.description: We discuss former FBI Director James Comey's indictment and the political fallout from a possible government shutdown starting next week.

Science.title: Southeast U.S. braces for heavy rains from a potential tropical storm
Science.description: The National Hurricane Center said a tropical depression currently hovering over the Caribbean could intensify as it approaches the East Coast. South Carolina's governor declared a state of emergency.

Science.title: Is taking acetaminophen during pregnancy really associated with autism in children?
Science.description: President Trump's announcement this week linking Tylenol with autism could play a role in ongoing legal cases against the company that makes it.

Science.title: Meteorite collectors gather in Cincinnati this weekend for 'Meet a Meteorite'
Science.description: Meteorites - the rocks that hurtle from outer space and make it to Earth, get a moment to shine when collectors gather in Cincinnati to show off the treasures they have found this Saturday.

Business.title: Government to guarantee £1.5bn Jaguar Land Rover loan after cyber shutdown
Business.description: Ministers hope the loan, from a commercial bank and underwritten by the government, will give certainty to suppliers.

Business.title: Experts say Trump's TikTok deal payment is a shakedown
Business.description: The U.S. government will collect a multibillion-dollar payment from the American investors who will take over TikTok. Some experts call it a fee and other deals like it "extortion."

Business.title: Reeves pushes for EU youth migration scheme ahead of Budget
Business.description: The chancellor calls for an 'ambitious' deal as she looks to boost growth ahead of the 26 November Budget.

Business.title: Harrods says customers' data stolen in IT breach
Business.description: The luxury department store says stolen information includes names and contact details.

Business.title: Teaching union demands action over 'failing' pension scheme
Business.description: The union says payment delays from the Teachers' Pension Scheme have left many in financial disarray.

Business.title: NPR and the Corporation for Public Broadcasting clash as federal funding declines
Business.description: NPR asked a federal judge to block CPB from awarding a $57.9 million grant to a new consortium of public media institutions to operate the satellite that connects the public radio system.

Culture.title: One Battle After Another star reflects on her breakthrough role
Culture.description: NPR's Andrew Limbong talks with Chase Infiniti about starring in One Battle After Another. It's her first movie role, where she plays Leonardo DiCaprio's daughter, and does all her own stunts.

Culture.title: America Ferrera talks about her role in the new film, 'The Lost Bus'
Culture.description: "The Lost Bus" tells the true story of a school bus driver who rescues 22 children during California's deadliest wildfire. NPR's Scott Simon speaks with America Ferrera, who plays a teacher in the film.

Culture.title: 'Rocky Horror' is 50! We propose a toast. (You know what to do)

Culture.description: The Norwegian singer-songwriter, who burst on to the scene as a teenager, says she's an introvert.

Culture.title: Judas Priest release Ozzy Osbourne charity single
Culture.description: Their Black Sabbath cover is raising money for Parkinson's research, the condition the late singer had.

Culture.title: TV station owners reinstate Kimmel show after ban
Culture.description: Viewers in Washington, DC, St Louis and Seattle will be able to watch the late night comedian's show again.

Culture.title: 'Primal and sexual': Wuthering Heights director on bringing Brontë to life

Culture.title: Flags, wars and fantasy kingdoms: Turner Prize artists let us into their worlds
Culture.description: Work by the four artists nominated for this year's award will go on show in Bradford this weekend.

Culture.title: ‘I’m petrified’: Backstage with Strictly stars ahead of live show
Culture.description: Fifteen couples are hoping to waltz their way to the glitterball trophy.
